name: Tim Storer
content: Tim Storer I am a Senior Lecturer in Software Engineering at the School of Computing Science, University of Glasgow, where I lead the Systems Engineering Group. Contact Information School of Computing Science University of Glasgow Sir Alwyn Williams Building Lilybank Gardens Glasgow G12 8QQ SCOTLAND Tel: 0141 330 4970 email timothy.storer@glasgow.ac.uk Research Interests I have research interests broadly in system, software and security engineering. Specifically: Modelling and simulation of large scale, complex, heterogeneous socio-technical systems. Applying principles, methods and tools from agile software engineering to security and digital investigation processes. Integrating agile and safety critical software engineering processes. Methods and tools for supporting software engineering practices in scientific programming development efforts. Data mining and linking software team project repositories. I'm particularly keen to work with external partners in industry and encourage my students to do so as well. I find software engineering research is best informed by the needs and challenges experienced by practitioners. Research Papers Robbie Simpson and Tim Storer.
